title: 14-Day Ban
body:
Let's start from a while ago. I had an idea with a friend of mine to literally int. I was dying but I got many kills and assists as well. He was only dying. After some time I'm playing a game with 3 premades other than me and one of us bans Mordekaiser while I told them I wanted to play Morde, just to trigger me. So it was only fair I trigger him as well and I inted like shit. 1/25. ONCE IN ABOUT 700 GAMES. And after 5 minutes I get a message telling me I got the ban. FOR 1 GAME. My friend (XtoxeusX, Yasuo) did exactly the same but stole a phew kills with a bit less deaths and he got nothing (His score might imply he didn't int but believe me he did). And to everyone who says it was because of prior bad behavior and such it literally said it was only because of my last game. And now I wonder. I only destroyed a 20-minute-match for 1 person (The Talon, our midlaner). The other team had fun of course. My premades didn't bother and the ones who reported me did it to laugh at me getting banned. Now if that 1 match where 1 person didn't have fun was enough for 10 fucking months of playing almost every day to get to lvl 4 honor (checkpoint 2) to be deleted that's up to Riot and they say it was. Plus a 14-day ban from playing but that's simply annoying, nothing more. 

Game my friend inted: https://matchhistory.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/EUN1/2226927777/226988541?tab=overview

Game I inted:
https://matchhistory.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/EUN1/2229617914/226988541?tab=overview

I would rather face a team of 5 scripters, than play with a single inter. 

No matter what, inting is the one most devastating thing for a game. A 14-day ban is MORE than adequate, and you don't get to have special treatment just because it's the first time you did it. The first time punishment for inting IS 14 days, exactly because of how severe it is.

And people downvoted you because it's so obvious that you deserve the 14-day ban. Why do you need us to tell you why you deserve it, when the client does the same thing?

er banning a intended pick is NOT team friendly, sure there are no rules against it, nor should there be, and doesn't excuse inting which IS against the rules and for good reason, but you can't say thats very nice of them... way back when i was learning the game all i knew how to play was teemo, but an teammate didnt like it so he banned teemo on me. back then teemo was RARELY banned, and if it did happen id dodge que. but because this was a team mate... i decided to play it out and show them why it was a bad idea to do that... you get the best games from helping your teammates... not by sabotaging them. you sabatoge them, its going to affect your game as well. banning your teammates intended pick... does just that. my team mate, didn't know i was an exclusive teemo player, that i was a new player, that i didn't have runes for anything else, that i didnt know any other champs and had to read the abilities and look up items to buy, and had no practice at all with other champs. so obviously, i did badly and they accused me of inting, which i was not. i legitimately sucked, because of all of the reasons given. nor did anything come of it, i didnt hear anything from riot about it so if they reported and it was reviewed, it wasnt seen as inting by the person who judged it either. (also the entire reason why i played teemo so much in the beginning, nothing else was because someone heard my voice and was like omg you sound like teemo, and im like what? and so they introduced me to LOL and had played bots with me over skype and got me to say teemo lines during the game XD they were... kinda obsessed with it. lol i liked it. =D some people don't like my voice, iv been self conscious of it in the past, so someone flipping out over it was something i loved. so naturally i played teemo all the time... lol though i don't even sound that much like him i definitely have a yordle voice...) *sample for fun* (excuse the poor sound quality) https://vocaroo.com/i/s1zGOzGHwfq9
Audio and voice recording >> also note, i wasn't putting on a voice to try and sound like teemo, thats my actual voice... >_> like i said, not perfectly teemo but definitely yordelish. iv learned a few more champs since then, so i have options, but teemo is still my best champ by far, so teammates banning him on me is still sabatoging, but i play it out, its their fault if i do badly. -_-; i still try my best but if it aint teemo i suck...

> you get the best games from helping your teammates... not by sabotaging them. you sabatoge them, its going to affect your game as well. banning your teammates intended pick... does just that.

But...why should the person with the pick intent be the one who 'wins?' Why does one person's wants outweigh another's? The problem is there's no answer to that question, so that's why draft modes have **BANS COME FIRST** to settle that argument.

im pretty sure thats not the reason that bans come first...

intent picks come first, so that the team mates know what their teammates want so they know what not to ban...

bans come before select because well.... it doesn't really make sense the other way around???

now, thinking from a standpoint of maybe they have a really bad matchup vs a certain champ, they can communicate that or worried the team will pick him first if not banned it its op that season, etc etc. there are reasons. which is why its not against the rules and why i said it shouldn't be.

but team wise, you don't know why your teammate is picking that champ, maybe they are queing with a friend and they have a good teamwork thing going, or maybe its just the champ they are best with etc. you don't know the person. by banning their intent, it is messing with their game. not to mention, its kinda rude, and is a bad way to start the game. the player will be in bad mood and sometimes thats enough to make them tilt. not intentionally just... mood does contribute to play performance. if you do something so early to tank that its not a good or helpful thing.


everyones priority to their teammates should be to boost them, help them, work together. not fight.

I find scriptors worse, tbh. cheating to win is way worse than getting mad and purposely losing. Cheating is ALWAYS worse.

note, don't mistake this for defending the op, im not, i just find argument with listing it as worse.
